translation.en: [woman] I'm really worried about him.
[man] Me too. I've never seen him this upset. -[woman] I know. -[man] He's taking it hard.

He said he'll never write another story ever again.

translation.en: -[man] He said that? -[woman] Yeah.
[crying] This is lame! Stupid!
I'm gonna burn all this stupid stuff!

translation.it: RAGAZZI PERDUTI Ciò che è successo stasera potrebbe reprimerlo e tormentarlo.

translation.en: or be this wound that haunts him.

Alex? I didn't hear anything.

and my boys.

-[door rattles] -Hello?
Hello?
Anyone?
I'm trapped!
Mom!
Dad!
-Hello? Help! -[electricity buzzes]
[woman] What is your name?
A… Alex.
[woman whispers] Alex.
-[Alex gasps] -[woman] Alex!
[gasps, yelps] Please, please.
[whispers] Boo. Let's get this over with. I'm a busy witch.

Uh, I… [grunts]
Do you see them? The apartment lured them in.

translation.en: That's what the apartment does.
Those children, they were not useful to me.

translation.en: Do you understand? So let's try this again.
Is there anything special about you at all?
Any reason I should let you live?
-And get up. -[whooshing]
[witch] Come closer.
Goodbye, Alex.
[hesitates] I do write scary stories.
Did you say "scary stories"?
What's… what's that?
No more questions. My Nightbooks. It's where I wrote my stories.

I was… I was gonna burn them in the boiler room downstairs.

-No. -Goodbye, Alex. They're good. They're very, really, really good.
translation.it: - No. Sono buone. Davvero buone. - Addio, Alex.

translation.en: Nightbooks, huh?
The title better not be the scariest thing about them.
I'm going to need a story every night.

translation.en: The story better be good, and it better be scary, or it's the last thing you'll ever do. [giggles]

translation.en: [breathing shakily] Hey.
-[meows] -[Alex] It's a little kitty.
Mischievous little thing.
How'd you get in here? -[hissing] -[Alex screaming]
[Alex] What is this place?
Where's the TV?
[Alex] And where'd the front door go?
Oh my God.
You scared me.
What?
-[Alex] You're a kid. -[girl] And you're a genius.

translation.en: I'm Alex. Who are you?
[sighs] You're gonna be chatty. Great. I'm Yasmin.

translation.en: Are you a prisoner too?
No, I'm on vacation.
Okay, food's here. Hope you like peanut butter. I used to.

translation.en: -Lenore tells her everything. -[Lenore growls] Come out, you evil skin-bag.

You say cat. I say Natacha's little spy-beast.

translation.en: And Natacha is…
Keep up. Natacha is the witch.
Lenore is that wrinkled, hairless thing that follows you around all day,
translation.it: Lenore è la cosa rugosa che ti segue sempre,

translation.en: popping up out of nowhere.
She ratted me out over a stinking cup of noodles. I hate that cat.

translation.en: Don't just stand there. Help me clean this up before Natacha gets home.

I don't know where she goes or what she does, but she can go anywhere she wants.

translation.en: Talk about the ultimate passport, this apartment is it.

translation.en: Come on. We both have work to do. I'll get you set up.

translation.en: Ultimate passport? The apartment travels all over the world, luring kids in.

translation.en: I'm from New York. Brooklyn. I live in Washington. Washington, DC.
translation.it: - Io sono di New York, Brooklyn. - Io di Washington, D.C.

translation.en: Or I did before.
I wonder if we're still in Brooklyn.
The apartment moves? When it needs fresh meat.
translation.it: - L'appartamento viaggia? - Se serve carne fresca.

translation.en: Not literally. Jeez. Thought you wrote scary stories.

translation.en: Not anymore.
This is so cool.
[echoing] How is…
I mean, wow!
It can't be.
Hello!
How is this even possible?
The apartment can do two things.
It lures suckers like us in, and it has room to hold…
translation.it: Attira gli sfigati come noi e ha spazio per tenere…

translation.en: This is so cool.
…well, anything.
The Empty Classroom and Other Creepy Stories.
translation.it: La classe vuota e altre storie di paura.

translation.en: Nightdreams and Daymares. Whispered Tales.
translation.it: Sogni notturni e incubi diurni. Racconti bisbigliati.

translation.en: She does like stories. I thought you said you weren't into that kinda stuff anymore.
translation.it: - Le piacciono davvero le storie. - Pensavo che a te non piacessero più.

translation.en: -I'm not. It's my friend. -Oh, it's your friend?
translation.it: - No, pensavo al mio amico. - Al tuo amico?

translation.en: He, uh… he'd like all this stuff.
But me? Nah. -He's, like… he's really lame. -Yeah, he sounds lame.
translation.it: - A me? No, ma lui è patetico. - Sì, che sfigato.

translation.en: Hmm. Cool. Okay, yeah. So she makes me read her a stupid scary story every night,
translation.it: Ok, beh, lei vuole che le legga una stupida storia di paura ogni sera,

translation.it: ma qui tutto è stato letto.

translation.en: Everything?
Good thing you're a storyteller. She needs you, so get to work.
translation.it: Per fortuna sei un narratore. Le servi, quindi mettiti al lavoro.

translation.en: You heard her. She wants a scary story tonight. Every day, write as many stories as you can.

translation.en: I don't write-- Cut the crap.

translation.en: Oh, those.
translation.it: - Le dicevi dei tuoi Racconti di paura. - Oh, quelli.

translation.en: I'm over the whole writing thing.
Then you better get over getting over it and crank out some new tales, 'cause if you don't--

translation.en: She'll kill me. I know.
You'll be lucky if she kills you.
This is your life now.

[Alex] Come on, open.
Where are you?
Another exit.
Damn.
Every time.
You all try and run.

You understand?

translation.en: -Should I just start reading? -[Lenore purring]
Give me a minute to get settled. I mean, honestly!

Do you know what happens to children who ask too many questions?

So, Storyteller,
you tried to escape today.

Read. Now.

[Alex] "Everyone avoided the Foster Playground at night." "They all knew the legend."

translation.en: Nope. No, no, no. Sorry, nope.
Everyone knows that ghosts haunt places that are personal to them, not public places.

I'm sure.
Get on with it.

children…"
-[Todd gasping] -[Alex] "…squealing, playing."
"Suddenly, a boy shoots out of the slide."

Hey… hey.
I… I mean… I mean hi. I'm looking for my friend, Jenny.

To find her, you have to play.

[Natacha] Stupid!
Everyone knows ghosts don't have actual physical hands,

Amateur.
The playground is… it's an interdimensional plane, a mix between the spirit world and the real world.

translation.en: -Whatever. Continue. -[Lenore meows]
[hesitates] "And then the children laugh, and they pull Todd to a rusty merry-go-round."

translation.en: "They spin him around and around, faster and faster, making Todd dizzier and dizzier."
translation.it: Lo fanno girare sempre più veloce, disorientandolo sempre di più.

"Until suddenly, someone grabs him and pulls him towards the exit."

"'Jenny, I… I wanted to see you.'" "'Get out of here,' Jenny says,
translation.it: 'Jenny, volevo vederti.' 'Esci di qui!', dice Jenny,

translation.en: not stopping for a happy reunion."
"Seeing his old friend again makes Todd's heart hurt." I miss you. I don't wanna let you go.
translation.it: Rivederla fa soffrire Todd. 'Mi manchi, non voglio lasciarti andare.'

translation.en: [Alex] "But in death, Jenny discovered something that Todd is about to learn."
translation.it: Ma nella morte, Jenny ha scoperto una cosa:

translation.en: Friends never let go, Todd. [Alex] "Because friends never forget."
translation.it: 'Gli amici non si lasciano mai, Todd, perché non dimenticano mai.

translation.en: [Jenny] I'll always be with you,
here.
A happy ending?
-[meows] -[distorted] Are you out of your mind? No happy endings, you fool.

translation.en: He… he screams for help, but it's no use.
His ghostly soul is trapped there to this very day.

translation.en: Did you at least like the story? I mean, until the ending?

translation.en: [sighs] Writers, always so insecure.
You're still alive, aren't you?
I'm mystified by you, Storyteller.
This beautiful darkness dances inside your brain.

translation.en: You should celebrate it.
But you run from it. Why?
I just…
[sighs] I… I wanna be like everyone else.
You wrote all this today? Uh, I had… I had trouble writing today.
translation.it: - Hai scritto tutto questo oggi? - Oggi non ho potuto scrivere.

It's just hard to concentrate with someone staring at me all day.

translation.en: I told you, show him the library and then get out.

Not her! Not her.
You were disturbing him.
-[meows] -It is very important that he writes.
You know how important it is.
Wait!
It… it wasn't her fault either.
Well, if it wasn't Yasmin's fault, and it wasn't Lenore's fault,
translation.it: Beh, se non è stata di Yasmin o di Lenore,

translation.it: allora di chi è stata la colpa?

translation.en: Mine. I'll… I'll write faster.
[Natacha] Lenore won't bother you again. No more excuses, Storyteller.

translation.en: [sighs] Are you okay?
Leave me alone.
[splutters] Yasmin, I'm sorry.
I wasn't trying to get you in any kind of trouble.
Yasmin, I'm sorry. I didn't know about the "no happy endings" thing.

translation.en: Todd shouldn't have gone back for Jenny.
translation.it: Todd non sarebbe dovuto andare lì per Jenny. È stato uno stupido.

translation.en: -He was stupid. -No, he wasn't.
translation.it: Todd non sarebbe dovuto andare lì per Jenny. È stato uno stupido. No, invece. È così che fanno gli amici.

translation.en: He was her friend, and that's what friends do.
translation.it: No, invece. È così che fanno gli amici.

translation.en: Maybe in fairy tales.
But in here? She's right, you know.

translation.en: Happy endings don't exist.
What?
What… what is that?
This place sucks.
She wants stories? Fine. I'll give her some stories.

translation.en: Yes! Yes, a haunted desk! Haunted by the spirit of somebody who died working at it.

translation.en: No, no, it's stupid. They're gonna think it's stupid.
How long you been here for?
Looks like a while. How'd they get you? They got me with a piece of pie and Lost Boys.

translation.en: Once upon a time,
Alex stared up at the ceiling.
Then the ceiling fell on him
translation.it: Poi il soffitto cadde su lui

translation.en: and put him out of his misery.
translation.it: e mise fine alle sue sofferenze. Fine.

translation.en: What's up there?
It's the oldest book in here. This thing's gotta be, like, a thousand years old.

translation.en: "Kinder und Hausmärchen."
"Rumpelstiltskin."
"Sleeping Beauty"?
Wow!
"Hansel and Gretel."
Is that a ballpoint pen?
Wow. "Frankenstein."
Oh my God.
It's writing.
"If I don't make it out of here, I need someone to know what happened,
translation.it: "Se non uscirò di qui, qualcuno deve sapere perché,

translation.en: even if it's only the characters in these books." "I saw a unicorn."
translation.it: anche se solo i personaggi dei libri. Ho visto un unicorno.

translation.en: "People said they didn't exist, but there it was." "I followed it into this apartment, and now I'm trapped by a witch."
translation.it: Era reale. L'ho seguito nell'appartamento e sono stata intrappolata da una strega.

translation.en: "She's mean and scary."
"I just have to do what the witch tells me to until Mom and Dad find me."
translation.it: "Devo fare quello che mi dice finché i miei non mi troveranno.

translation.en: "There are other kids here. Most of them are nice." "I'm scared, but at least I'm not alone."
translation.it: Ci sono altri bambini molto gentili qui. Ho paura, ma almeno non sono sola."

translation.en: Dinner in an hour. Hey, Yasmin,
translation.it: - La cena è tra un'ora. - Yasmin.

translation.en: do you like unicorns? Yeah, 'cause that's so me.
translation.it: - Ti piacciono gli unicorni? - Come no? È così da me.

translation.en: Oh, I thought maybe that's how she got you.
translation.it: Oh, ho pensato che ti avesse presa così.

translation.en: Natacha, I mean.
You're right. It's none of my business.
translation.it: Lo so, sono affari tuoi. Certo non ti avrà attirata

translation.en: And I bet you weren't lured in by a stupid movie and a piece of pie.
translation.it: Lo so, sono affari tuoi. Certo non ti avrà attirata uno stupido film e della torta. Stupida torta di zucca.

translation.en: Stupid pumpkin pie.
translation.it: uno stupido film e della torta. Stupida torta di zucca.

translation.en: Fine.
It was doro wat.
What the hell is doro wat?
Chicken, onions caramelized in spiced butter, paprika, garlic, ginger, berbere spice.
translation.it: Pollo, cipolle caramellate nel burro, paprika, aglio, zenzero, spezie berbere.

translation.en: My āyatē… My grandmother and I used to make it before she died.
translation.it: La mia āyatē… mia nonna e io lo facevamo prima che morisse.

translation.en: We even grew all the herbs and veggies ourselves.
Anyways, I smelled doro wat, and I just so badly wanted to see my āyatē again.
translation.it: Comunque, ho sentito l'odore di doro wat e volevo rivedere la mia āyatē.

translation.en: But it wasn't her. It was a witch,
translation.it: Ma non c'era lei. C'era una strega.

translation.en: an evil, wicked witch.
How's that for a happy ending?
[Alex] "With the fangs came the hunger,
and Katie discovered that her hunch was right." "To a vampire, blood does taste like candy."
translation.it: e Katie scoprì che, per un vampiro, il sangue sa di caramelle."

translation.en: You're stupid.
[Alex] Here, Lenore, a peace offering.
[mutters] Story.
There's gotta be more writing from that Unicorn Girl.
translation.it: La Ragazza Unicorno avrà scritto altro.

translation.en: "…but it's too late. The roller coaster plunges down the drop."
translation.it: "…è tardi. Il treno dell'ottovolante precipita. Suoni striduli di metallo spezzato.

translation.it: Il treno dell'ottovolante precipita. Suoni striduli di metallo spezzato.

translation.en: humans scream,
translation.it: Esseri umani gridano e il cane del Cupo Mietitore

translation.en: Isn't that right, Lenore?
This is gonna take forever!
"They saw their son's footprints in the snow, leading into the woods." "Then they saw a pair of smaller footprints,
translation.it: "Videro le impronte del figlio nella neve, verso il bosco, poi impronte più piccole,

translation.en: teddy-bear-sized." "And they never saw their precious son again."
translation.it: della grandezza di un orsacchiotto e non videro mai più il figlio."

translation.en: [Natacha] Possessed teddy bears? Really?
Took me right out of the story. Every good story hints at truth.

translation.en: The more truth, the more powerful the story.
translation.it: Più verità c'è, più potente è la storia.

translation.en: From now on, get your facts straight.
translation.it: D'ora in poi, informati bene sui fatti.

translation.en: Yes!
"I don't know how long I've been here." "I still have the necklace Mom and Dad gave me."
translation.it: "Non so da quanto tempo sono qui. Indosso ancora il regalo dei miei.

translation.en: "I used to touch it to remember them, but I stopped." "It made me cry."
translation.it: Toccavo questa collana per ricordarli, ma ora non più, mi faceva piangere.

translation.en: "I'm tired of crying."
"I have what I need to escape tonight." "I'm finally going to see them again, Mom and Dad."
translation.it: "Ho il necessario per fuggire stasera. Finalmente rivedrò i miei.

translation.en: "I wonder if they'll even know me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.it: Ma mi riconosceranno? La gente può dimenticare i figli?"

translation.en: -"Escape"? -[Yasmin] Alex?
Oh my God! [gasps]
You did not just throw a book at me!
Uh, no. You just surprised me. I dropped it.
translation.it: No. Mi hai sorpreso e mi è caduto.

translation.en: Hold on. I'm coming down.
Hey, Yasmin, wait until you see what I found.
translation.it: Ehi, Yasmin, aspetta di vedere cosa ho trovato.

translation.en: Hey, what's wrong?
This is Natacha's night nursery. Night nursery?
translation.it: - È la serra notturna di Natacha. - Notturna?

translation.en: Yeah. Sunlight is bad for magical plants. Come on.
translation.it: Sì. Il sole fa male alle piante magiche. Vieni.

translation.en: What's all this for?
Ingredients mostly, for Natacha's potions.
translation.it: Natacha le usa per le pozioni.

translation.en: Don't touch anything.
What's that?
Demon silk.
Enough questions. Help me with this.
I watered the vine with rat's blood instead of bat's blood.
translation.it: Ho dato alla vite il sangue sbagliato e ha fatto uova di Tritante.

translation.en: Now, Shredder eggs are growing on it. If one of them hatches,
translation.it: Ho dato alla vite il sangue sbagliato e ha fatto uova di Tritante. Se uno si schiude e distrugge la serra, sono morta.

translation.en: it can destroy the night nursery, and Natacha will kill me.
translation.it: Se uno si schiude e distrugge la serra, sono morta.

translation.en: -[Yasmin] I'm taking care of it, Lenore. -[meows]
[whispering] Okay. Put it gently on the ground.
Be careful. Don't jostle it.
Be careful.
Okay, now what?
Stomp it as hard as you can.
Good.
[Alex] Where's the blue mist come from? Do you make it? The mist, do you think it keeps Natacha young?
translation.it: Quel vapore blu, lo fai tu? Mantiene Natacha giovane?

translation.en: It's none of our business.
I mean, she's really pretty, but her books are ancient, and the apartment looks like a granny decorated it.
translation.it: È bella, ma ha libri antichissimi e l'appartamento è in stile nonnina.

translation.en: [Alex, distorted] No!
I thought for sure it was gonna--
-[panting] -[Yasmin] Did you get it?
It's getting away!
-No! No! -No!
It's cutting down the Shredder eggs! Stomp on them!
translation.it: Ha tagliato le altre uova! Calpestale!

translation.en: Sorry.
That's all the Shredder eggs.
[Yasmin] There it is! Don't let it get away!
[gasps] Alex, look out!
Thanks, Yas. [spluttering] I mean, Yasmin.
Wait. Where is it?
We need to find it and kill it before it destroys the whole place.
[scoffs] Well, that's just great!
[Alex] Get it off me!
[yelps] Oh God!
I'm okay. I'm okay. I'm okay.
[Yasmin] It's gone.
I don't know where it went. [breathes shakily]
Let's go!
-Come on! -Wait.
[Alex] Gotcha.
Now let's get out of here.
You useless little twits.
You've been misbehaving in my garden.
translation.it: Avete fatto i cattivi nel mio giardino.

translation.en: This will hurt you far more than it hurts me. [chuckles]
translation.it: Questo farà molto più male a te che a me.

translation.en: [crying] Please, I… I can explain.
[Natacha] And I would let you
if I cared.
Do try to keep your eyes open. I would hate to have to start over.
translation.it: Cerca di tenere gli occhi aperti. Non vorrei dover ricominciare da capo.

translation.en: [distorted] Can't you do anything right? I said keep your eyes open!
translation.it: Non riesci a fare bene nulla? Ho detto tieni gli occhi aperti!

translation.en: It was my fault! I begged Yasmin to take me to the nursery.
translation.it: È stata colpa mia! L'ho pregata di portarmi nella serra.

translation.en: I thought the creepy plants might help me think of something cool to write about.
translation.it: Cercavo l'ispirazione per scrivere belle storie.

translation.en: She made me promise not to touch anything, but I did.
translation.it: Non dovevo toccare niente, ma l'ho fatto.

translation.en: Don't hurt her. Please.
translation.it: Non le faccia del male, la prego.

translation.en: That is very brave of you, Storyteller,
to lie right to my face.
I almost killed you.
If I didn't need you to clean up the mess, I would've. No more chances.
translation.it: Devi ripulire la serra o l'avrei fatto. Non avrai altre chance.

translation.en: Yas, you okay?
Look, I'm sorry I got you involved.
translation.it: Senti, mi dispiace di averti coinvolto.

translation.en: From now on, you help yourself. I'll help myself.
translation.it: D'ora in poi, ognuno di noi aiuta sé stesso.

translation.en: [spluttering] Yas, we can get out of here, together.
translation.it: Yas, possiamo andarcene da qui, insieme.

translation.en: It's not Yas.
It's Yasmin.
-[screeching] -Shredder!
[grunts] Gotcha!
-[Shredder screeching] -[Alex] Here we go. Okay.
One…
[breathing heavily] …two,
three!
Get… get off me! Get off me! Get off!
-[screeching] -[Alex] No! No! No!
No! No! No! No! No! No! No!
Ugh! My Nightbooks.
-[Alex] Watch out. -[Lenore meows] Lenore's here somewhere.
translation.it: Fai attenzione. Lenore è qui da qualche parte.

translation.en: -She's hurting. -[Yasmin] You look terrible.
translation.it: - È ferita. - Che brutto aspetto. Hai fatto nottata?

translation.en: -You've been here all night? -Yeah, all night. [sighs]
translation.it: - È ferita. - Che brutto aspetto. Hai fatto nottata? Sì. In bianco.

translation.en: I made this. It'll help with the scrapes and cuts.
translation.it: Ho fatto questa. Aiuterà con i tagli.

translation.en: You made this for me?
Yeah, it's my own concoction. It's a kind of aloe from a harpy plant, some dried corpse-hair vine.
translation.it: Sì, con l'aloe di una pianta arpìa e della rampicante-cadavere essiccata.

translation.en: That's good. Really good.
Thanks.
Uh, Lenore?
-Come here. -[Lenore meows]
Look what Yas made for us. Didn't make it for her.
translation.it: - Questa ce l'ha fatta Yas. - Non per lei.

translation.en: [Alex] There you go, all better.
It's okay. Here we go. No.
I'm in trouble.
I… I… I don't have any stories.
What do you mean you don't have any? You said you had a bunch of them.
translation.it: Cosa? Hai detto che ne avevi tante.

translation.en: I did, but a Shredder, it got into my room. And I killed it, but it destroyed all of my Nightbooks,
translation.it: Sì, ma c'era un Tritante nella mia stanza e ha distrutto i miei Racconti di paura.

translation.en: except for this one. I was reading to Natacha from those Nightbooks.
translation.it: Mi rimane solo questo. A Natacha leggevo quelli.

translation.en: I've got nothing now. I… I have to escape. I have no choice!
translation.it: Non ho più niente. Devo andarmene. Non ho scelta.

translation.en: There are two ways out. The front door where you came in and the back door--
translation.it: C'è solo la porta frontale e quella sul retro…

translation.en: The back door! It goes outside. I saw Natacha go through there. There's--
translation.it: Dalla porta sul retro si esce. Natacha è passata di lì.

translation.en: But Natacha's the only one that has the keys to that door. You need to get over this escape nonsense and write something.
translation.it: Ma Natacha ha l'unica chiave. Smetti di pensare alla fuga e scrivi.

translation.en: -I've been trying! -Try harder!
I can't write!
-[sighs] -Look, Natacha will find out tonight.
-I'll be useless to her. She'll kill me. -She won't just kill you.
translation.it: - Sarò inutile e mi ucciderà. - Non solo quello.

translation.en: There were four of us.
Eli, Little Hwan, Claire,
and me.
Hwan was too young, but the rest of us took turns reading to Natacha.
translation.it: Tranne il piccolo Hwan, leggevamo a turno a Natacha.

translation.en: Afterwards, we'd all huddle together at night and dream about escaping.
translation.it: Dopo, ci riunivamo tutti insieme la sera e sognavamo di fuggire.

translation.en: [hesitates] You're saying these are…
Last night, I almost joined them. One day, the kitchen sink got clogged.
translation.it: Ieri mi sono quasi unita a loro. Un giorno, il lavello in cucina si intasò.

translation.en: Natacha's magic couldn't fix it.
That's because I blocked the pipe myself with starstell moss.
translation.it: perché bloccai io il tubo col muschio stellato…

translation.en: The moss resists magic.
[crying] I wanted to force Natacha to call the plumber.
I taped a note under the sink for him to find, begging him to get help.
translation.it: Gli misi un biglietto sotto il lavandino, implorando aiuto.

translation.en: But…
he never came.
Natacha found the note, didn't she?
Claire spent her last moments convincing Natacha that she did it…
translation.it: Claire convinse Natacha che l'aveva scritto lei…

translation.en: not me.
Claire lied to save me.
Like… you did.
'Cause that's what friends do.
[breathes shakily] I used to love writing scary stories,
translation.it: Mi piaceva scrivere storie di paura,

translation.en: but then I decided to stop.
translation.it: ma poi ho deciso di smettere.

translation.en: And now that I have to write…
the… the ideas won't come to me anymore.
translation.it: le idee non mi vengono più.

translation.en: Did Hwan wear a watch?
[Yasmin] Yeah. A big, blue plastic one. Why?
-And Claire, those earrings? -[Yasmin] They were her aunt's.
translation.it: - E gli orecchini di Claire? - Erano di sua zia.

translation.en: Why?
There's a way out of this place.
-"I have what I need to escape tonight." -"Escape," Yasmin.
"I'm finally gonna see them again, Mom and Dad."
"I wonder if they'll remember me." "Can people forget their kids?"
translation.it: Ma mi riconosceranno? La gente può dimenticare i figli?"

translation.en: Unicorn Girl never took this off, and none of the kids in the cabinet are wearing it.
translation.it: La Ragazza Unicorno aveva questo. Quei bambini non ce l'hanno.

translation.en: You're right. And if she's not in the cabinet, then--
translation.it: Hai ragione e se lei non è qui…

translation.en: She did it. She escaped.
translation.it: Ce l'ha fatta. È fuggita. Mise i suoi appunti in vari libri

translation.en: I've been piecing together her notes. There are bits here and there.
translation.it: Ce l'ha fatta. È fuggita. Mise i suoi appunti in vari libri perché Natacha non scoprisse eventualmente…

translation.en: She hid them throughout the books, so in case Natacha found out--
She wouldn't know her full plan.
Okay, what's your plan?
Your plan sucks. We're not gonna find this today. You need to write a story for tonight. -Like right now. -[Alex sighs]
translation.it: È terribile. Non lo troveremo oggi. Scrivi una storia per stasera, subito.

translation.en: What do we do? It'd take, like, a thousand years to search all these books.
translation.it: Come faremo? Servirebbero mille anni per cercare in tutti i libri.

translation.en: A thousand years.
The thousand-year-old book.
The pen marks in the old book!
Come on. Please be here.
translation.it: Dai. Ti prego, devi essere qui.

translation.en: Is this the original "Hansel and Gretel"? [Alex] Grimm's Fairy Tales.
translation.it: - "Hänsel e Gretel"? - Fiabe del focolare dei Grimm.

translation.en: [Yasmin] That's totally unrealistic. No one would just eat candy off of a strange house.
translation.it: È inverosimile, chi mangerebbe una strana casa fatta di caramelle?

translation.en: [gasps] I was right! More writing! [Yasmin] It's a recipe for a sleeping potion.
translation.it: - Sì, ha scritto di più! - Una pozione per dormire.

translation.en: "It smells awful." "I need to figure out how to hide the stink so she'll drink it."
translation.it: "Puzza. Devo mascherare la puzza per fargliela bere.

translation.en: "I'm so close. I'll put her to sleep and steal her keys." "I wish I had magic."
translation.it: Mentre dorme, le ruberò le chiavi. Se avessi poteri magici,

translation.en: "I'd turn her into a toad or a snail and laugh at her all day long."
translation.it: la trasformerei in un rospo o una lumaca per deriderla.

translation.en: "Then I would turn her into a centipede and rip off her legs." "All hundred legs, one at a time."
translation.it: Poi in un millepiedi, per strapparle le gambe una per una."

translation.en: I'll keep looking. You have to write a story.
translation.it: Continuo a cercare. Tu scrivi una storia.

translation.en: [hesitates] I don't think I can.
You're the only one who can. You've gotta buy us more time.
translation.it: Sì che puoi. Devi guadagnare tempo.

translation.en: You don't think I'm weird?
That I…
I like to write scary stories?
translation.it: mi piaccia scrivere storie di paura?

translation.en: Weird? Who called you that?
translation.it: Strano? Chi ti ha chiamato così?

translation.en: Well, they're right. You are weird. I mean, look at you.
translation.it: Beh, hanno ragione, sei strano. Voglio dire, guardati.

translation.en: But the thing that makes you weird makes them ordinary.
translation.it: Ma quello che ti rende strano, rende loro ordinari.

translation.en: And no one likes to be ordinary. Ordinary sucks.
translation.it: E a nessuno piace esserlo, fa schifo.

translation.en: So ordinary people are gonna try and take that away from you…
translation.it: Ecco perché provano a portartelo via…

translation.en: by calling you names like
-Tryhard or-- -Creepshow.
Yeah, or Creepshow.
Thanks, Yasmin.
It's Yas.
Do you have those ingredients? [Yasmin] Yeah. Yeah, I do.
translation.it: - Hai questi ingredienti? - Sì, ce li ho.

translation.en: But she's right. Suckleweed stinks.
How did she mask the smell? She must've found another ingredient.
translation.it: - Come ha mascherato la puzza? - Con un altro ingrediente?

translation.en: [Yasmin] The only other person who would know is Natacha, but she would never tell us.
translation.it: Lo saprebbe solo Natacha, ma non ce lo direbbe mai.

translation.en: I do have an idea.
I could write a story to trick her into giving us the final ingredient of the sleeping potion.
translation.it: Potrei scrivere una storia per indurla a dircelo.

translation.en: [Yasmin] You know what happens if she figures out what we're up to?
translation.it: Sai cosa succede se ci scopre, vero?

translation.en: [Alex] I know what happens if we don't try. [Yasmin] What's the name of the story?
translation.it: - Dobbiamo provarci. - Come chiamerai la storia?

translation.en: [Natacha] Not that one.
You're happy with that one.
I don't like you happy.
I want a story that'll make you squirm.
translation.it: Voglio una storia che ti faccia rabbrividire.

translation.en: Here's the story I want.
Why burn your Nightbooks?
translation.it: perché volevi bruciare i Racconti di paura?

translation.en: You thought I forgot about that, didn't you?
I was…
I was… I just… I was… [sighs]
Uh… Oh my God. I'm so sorry. I'm so stupid.
translation.it: Oddio. Mi dispiace. Sono così stupida.

translation.en: Yes, you are. I've only been saying that for years. Now you get it. [sighs heavily]
translation.it: Sì, lo sei. Lo dico da anni. L'hai capito ora.

translation.en: Where was I?
You were about to tell me to start reading.
Oh yes. Well then, what are you waiting for?
translation.it: Ah, già. Beh, cosa stiamo aspettando?

translation.en: Get on with it.
[Alex] "For generations, the evil sorcerer of Quantel sent children to mine jewels from the mouth of the great monster."
translation.it: "Lo stregone di Quantel inviava i bambini a cavare gioielli dalla bocca del mostro."

translation.en: [Alex] "A thousand years ago, the evil sorcerer had a chance to kill the odious beast,
translation.it: "Mille anni fa, lo stregone avrebbe potuto ucciderlo,

translation.en: but instead he used a powerful potion to keep the monster unconscious, to make himself rich."
translation.it: ma manteneva l'odiosa bestia incosciente con una pozione, invece, per arricchirsi."

translation.en: "Odious." Good word.
[Alex] "Every morning, the sorcerer funneled his potion down the monster's fifth ear,
translation.it: "Ogni mattina, gli metteva la pozione nel quinto orecchio

translation.en: and the beast remained unconscious." "The recipe was as old as time."
translation.it: e la bestia rimaneva priva di sensi. La formula era antica.

translation.en: "Dissolved rat's bones, dry-aged widow orchid, powdered beetle shells."
translation.it: Ossa di ratto sciolte, orchidea vedova, gusci di scarabeo in polvere.

translation.en: "But the most important ingredient, however, was bindweed."
translation.it: Ma il convolvolo era l'ingrediente più importante,

translation.en: "Bindweed was the only thing that could hide the powerful stench of the potion."
translation.it: perché mascherava la puzza rancida della pozione

translation.en: "Without it, the rancid smell would rouse the great monster."
"But one day, the sorcerer went to harvest more bindweed,
translation.it: Un giorno, lo stregone andò a raccogliere il convolvolo, ma lo trovò tutto

translation.en: and he discovered that the entire field had withered and died."
translation.it: Un giorno, lo stregone andò a raccogliere il convolvolo, ma lo trovò tutto appassito e morto.

translation.en: "The potion smelled worse than ever." "Putrid, rank, malodorous--"
translation.it: La pozione puzzava più che mai. Putrida. Rancida. Maleodorante…"

translation.en: Oh, yes, yes, yes. Understood. It stinks.
[Alex] "The sorcerer would have to kill the great monster once and for all."
translation.it: "Lo stregone doveva uccidere il mostro una volta per tutte.

translation.en: "He reluctantly raised his mighty staff to kill the beast,
translation.it: Alzò la potente staffa per uccidere la bestia,

translation.en: but a peasant girl came to him and promised a solution to his problem."
translation.it: ma una contadina gli propose una soluzione.

translation.en: I know a replacement for bindweed. Your jewel harvest can continue. Foolish child. You know nothing of real magic.
translation.it: 'Conosco un sostituto del convolvolo.' 'Stupida bambina. Non conosci la magia.'

translation.en: I can prove it. And if I do, I want a bag of jewels.
translation.it: 'Lo proverò, ma voglio un sacchetto di gioielli.'

translation.en: If it works, you will get two bags.
If not, you will give me your life.
translation.it: Altrimenti, mi darai la tua vita.'

translation.en: [Alex] "The peasant girl stepped forward and poured a mysterious dark liquid into the jug."
translation.it: La contadina versò un liquido scuro nella pozione.

translation.en: "The evil sorcerer sniffed the potion."
translation.it: Lo stregone la annusò e la puzza era scomparsa!

translation.en: "The smell disappeared. The sorcerer couldn't believe it."
translation.it: Lo stregone la annusò e la puzza era scomparsa! Lo stregone sentiva l'odore di margherite, di rose, di lillà, di primavera…"

translation.en: "It smelled like daisies, roses, lilacs on a spring morning--"
translation.it: Lo stregone sentiva l'odore di margherite, di rose, di lillà, di primavera…"

translation.en: [Alex] "The evil sorcerer poured the potion into the monster's ear and waited."
translation.it: "Lo stregone versò la pozione nell'orecchio del mostro.

translation.en: "The beast let out a long… [in low voice] …grumble
translation.it: La bestia emise un lungo borbottio,

translation.en: then went still again."
"Yes! But the peasant girl had removed more than just the smell from the potion."
translation.it: 'Sì!' Ma la contadina non aveva tolto solo la puzza,

translation.en: "She'd also erased all of its magic."
translation.it: ma anche la magia dalla pozione,

translation.en: "The sorcerer's potion was rendered useless."
"The peasant girl nodded to something behind him."
translation.it: La contadina gli fece cenno di girarsi.

translation.en: [Alex] "The eyes of the great monster were open."
translation.it: Gli occhi del mostro erano aperti.

translation.en: "The sorcerer shrieked." [Alex] "The peasant girl watched it all, smiling."
translation.it: Lo stregone strillò. La contadina guardò tutto sorridendo.

translation.en: "The evil sorcerer had sent her baby brother into that cave, and he never returned."
translation.it: Lo stregone aveva mandato suo fratello nella caverna e lui non era più tornato.

translation.en: "The peasant girl cared nothing about jewels." "She got what she wanted, revenge."
translation.it: A lei non importava dei gioielli. Voleva vendetta.

translation.en: "And so she walked away as the monster's sharp teeth chomped down on the shrieking sorcerer,
translation.it: Se ne andò mentre i denti del mostro masticavano lo stregone che urlava,

translation.en: silencing him forever."
"Just as the peasant girl thought she'd gotten away with it all, a black shadow loomed over her."
translation.it: La contadina pensò di essersela cavata, ma un'ombra calò su di lei.

translation.en: "It was the monster's giant foot, right above her."
translation.it: Era il piede gigante del mostro.

translation.en: -"Splat." -[meows]
"The end."
"And not a happy one."
Bindweed?
Yeah, me and Yasmin researched for hours. I know how important it is to get all the details right--
translation.it: Sì, io e Yasmin abbiamo fatto ricerche per i dettagli giusti…

translation.en: -[Natacha] No. -No?
I-- Of course I made up the potion's ingredients,
but I was sure that bindweed hides odors.
translation.it: ma ero sicura che il convolvolo nascondesse gli odori.

translation.en: -I really thought we got it right. -Well, there's your mistake. You worked with her.
translation.it: - Pensavo che fosse giusto. - L'errore è che hai chiesto a lei.

translation.en: Bindweed keeps liquid from separating.
translation.it: Il convolvolo non fa separare i liquidi.

translation.en: Everyone knows cinaroot hides smells, not bindweed.
translation.it: Tutti sanno che la radice fosca nasconde gli odori, non il convolvolo.

translation.en: Cinaroot, of course.
Is that cinaroot with an "S" or a "C"?
Okay. Let's do some science stuff.
translation.it: Ok, facciamo un po' di scienza.

translation.en: Tonight, we're getting out of here.
[Alex] Good night, Natacha.
Oh my God. What's happening? It's turning green. I can't bring this out there.
translation.it: Oddio. Che succede? Sta diventando verde. Non posso portargliela.

translation.en: Some kind of reaction?
Maybe the acidity of the lemonade-- The service here is terrible. [sighs]
translation.it: - All'acidità dei limoni? - Il servizio fa schifo.

translation.en: I don't have a story. We put two drops in the glass.
translation.it: - Non ho una storia. - Metti le gocce nella brocca.

translation.en: -Let's put two in the pitcher. -Will it put her to sleep?
translation.it: - Non ho una storia. - Metti le gocce nella brocca. Ma dormirà?

translation.en: Where is my lemonade?
It's coming!
What? I put it right here.
-Where is it? -What are you talking about?
Where is the potion? This has to happen.
She knows.
So, uh…
So it's…
It's…
Let's see.
So, um…
Any day now, Storyteller.
Yeah, yeah. It's, uh… it's here somewhere.
translation.it: Sì, è qui da qualche parte.

translation.en: Spit it out.
Oh, okay.
-I just gotta find it. -Read!
[chuckles] Here it is.
So, um, this one is, um, called "The Cuckoo Clock."
[Alex] When Scott's parents bought the cuckoo clock at an estate sale,
translation.it: I genitori di Scott comprarono un orologio a cucù

translation.en: he thought it was just another old-timey piece of junk.
translation.it: e lui pensò che fosse solo un vecchio rottame.

translation.en: But there was something strange about the clock.
translation.it: Ma c'era qualcosa di strano riguardo all'orologio.

translation.en: Every hour on the hour, the little cuckoo would pop out,
translation.it: Ogni ora, il piccolo cuculo saltava fuori

translation.en: and, uh, Steve started to notice--
Who's Steve?
I thought you said his name was Scott.
[laughs nervously] Sorry. Right. Uh, typo. So… so Scott noticed that, uh, the cuckoo
translation.it: Sì, scusi. Errore di scrittura. Scott notò che il cuculo

translation.en: Like, its eyes would--

translation.en: -[distorted] Quiet, girl. -[breathing heavily]

Run!

[Yasmin] Alex?

-Yas? -[chuckles]

[echoing] Hello?

-Well, well, well! -[gasps] Sleeping Beauty awakes.

-Alex! -[Alex gasps]

translation.en: [distorted] The original witch, who, by the way, does eat children.

translation.en: We thought you were the original witch. We thought the blue mist kept you young.

translation.en: I don't need the mist to keep me young. It gives me her magic.

translation.en: What?
How?
I was about your age when she got me.

translation.en: There were lots of us back then.
But we weren't dumb.
We knew not to get attached,
because she got hungry.
She ate them?
Yes.
All of them.

translation.en: I pretended to like her.
Pretended to want to be like her. I became her favorite.

translation.en: But when I was alone, I plotted my escape.
translation.it: Ma quando ero sola, pianificavo la mia fuga.

translation.en: I would get her to trust me.

but my parents were gone.

You were just like us.

Stories of fear and suffering and death are like sweet lullabies to her.

Okay! Okay!

translation.it: Ogni giorno, inventava nuovi modi per spaventare i compagni di classe.

translation.en: But… [sighs] …they just didn't get his fascination with creepy things.
translation.it: Ma loro non capivano il suo interesse per le cose inquietanti.

translation.en: To them, he was just… weird.

translation.en: "What's wrong with you?" they'd ask. Many of them were cruel,
translation.it: "Cos'hai che non va?", chiedevano. Molti erano crudeli

Josh was his best friend since kindergarten.

translation.en: Alex finishes his latest bone-chilling tale,
translation.it: Alex finisce l'ultima storia e vuole mostrargliela.

Hey, Josh?

…says Alex, confused and hurt.

You're my best friend.

translation.en: [laughs] Come on. The way you dress, the things you like.

translation.en: "All you do is talk about your scary stories." Everyone thinks it's weird.

Yo, Josh, you comin'?
Come on, J-Man.
All right, all right. Alex, I'll see you later, okay?

translation.en: [crying] He, his mom, and his dad had turned his whole apartment into that house.

translation.en: No one showed up…
not even Josh.
They made him hate the thing he loved most.

translation.en: And they made him hate himself.
translation.it: E gli fecero odiare sé stesso.

translation.en: The real truth is, he was embarrassed to be himself,
translation.it: La verità è che si vergognava di essere sé stesso

translation.en: so he decided to burn his Nightbooks.
translation.it: e decise di bruciare i suoi Racconti di paura.

translation.en: He swore he'd never write another story again.

translation.en: He could be a new person.

The boy lost all his friends, so he decided to destroy that part of himself

-[meows] -No. -No! -This is our happy ending!

You did this to me.
I have lived in fear of you for so long, but I am not that little girl anymore.

-No! No! No! No! -No! No! No! No!

No. I'm sorry. -No! -[thudding]
-[meows] -Lenore!
-No. No. -[witch growling]
"Stories about fear and death are like lullabies to her." [Yasmin] No, no, no.

She's read all of them. No! [crying]
Hey, ugly.
You like stories? I got stories.

translation.it: Jason non sapeva perché sua sorella moriva

translation.it: Jason non sapeva perché sua sorella moriva ogni martedì alle 11:15 e tornava in vita 20 minuti dopo.

Zachary had always thought that clowns were the scariest part of the circus. He was wrong.

translation.en: Who? Who was it?
Who was it?
-The stories! -[Alex] Push her! Push her in!
[Alex] Keep pushing!
[Alex] Don't let her out!
Keep it shut! Keep pushing!
-[Yasmin] Keep it shut! -[Alex] Keep her in!
-[both panting] -[Yasmin] Oh my God.
So that's why they call you a tryhard? Shut up, Creepshow.

♪ Blind boys don't lie… ♪

[gasps] Alex? Oh my…

♪ Thou shall not die ♪ ♪ Unchain me, sister! ♪

translation.en: Oh God, you scared me.
-Hey, Creepshow. -Hey, Tryhard.
My parents drove me up to surprise you.

translation.en: -What is that? Like, your third story? -Fourth, actually.

translation.en: So you could definitely use this.
Oh my God, Yas.
[Yasmin] Check out the flowers. My next science fair project. The effect of ultraviolet black light on photosynthetic organisms.

translation.en: [Alex] Still don't believe in happy endings? [Yasmin] I'm starting to.
